solution_line_template: The perimeter of the lake is {sides_of_square}*{side_length}=<<{sides_of_square}*{side_length}={perimeter}>>{perimeter} miles
He swims at a speed of {minutes_per_hour}/{swim_time_minutes_per_mile}=<<{minutes_per_hour}/{swim_time_minutes_per_mile}={swim_speed_mph}>>{swim_speed_mph} mph
So he rows at a speed of {swim_speed_mph}*{rowing_speed_multiplier}=<<{swim_speed_mph}*{rowing_speed_multiplier}={row_speed_mph}>>{row_speed_mph} mph
That means it takes him {perimeter}/{row_speed_mph}=<<{perimeter}/{row_speed_mph}={time_to_row_lake_hours}>>{time_to_row_lake_hours} hours to row around the lake
